intro: Pilosella incrassata, commonly known as the rough pappus hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Pilosella incrassata is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and light conditions.
